results.name: a(n) = A156552(sigma(A005940(1+n))).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..479
Index entries for sequences related to binary expansion of n
Index entries for sequences related to sigma(n)
mathematica: Array[Floor@ Total@ Flatten@ MapIndexed[#1 2^(#2 - 1) &, Flatten[Table[2^(PrimePi@ #1 - 1), {#2}] & @@@ FactorInteger@ DivisorSigma[1, #]]] &@ Block[{p = Partition[Split[Join[IntegerDigits[#, 2], {2}]], 2], q}, Times @@ Flatten[Table[q = Take[p, -i]; Prime[Count[Flatten[q], 0] + 1]^q[[1, 1]], {i, Length[p]}]]] &, 70, 0] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Feb 12 2020, after _Robert G. Wilson v_ at A005940 *)
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Feb 12 2020
